trans-unit.source: Welcome to WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground
trans-unit.target: Welcome to WDG CPub Open Publishing Playground

trans-unit.source: We are happy to announce the arrival of the WDG CPub Playground.
trans-unit.target: We are happy to announce the arrival of the WDG CPub Playground.

trans-unit.source: Git logo
trans-unit.target: Git logo

trans-unit.source: Markdown logo
trans-unit.target: Markdown logo

trans-unit.source: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content, and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.
trans-unit.target: Here you can experiment with markdown and GitHub to your heart's content, and then see how your markdown renders in MSDN's Open Publishing environment.

trans-unit.source: If you are already familiar with GitHub, are part of the Microsoft organization, and want to dive right in, skip down to the "Set up your personal playground" section.
trans-unit.target: If you are already familiar with GitHub, are part of the Microsoft organization, and want to dive right in, skip down to the "Set up your personal playground" section.

trans-unit.source: If you see anything in this topic that is no longer correct or that just bothers you in some way you can't really explain, please fix it by submitting a pull request with the changes.
trans-unit.target: If you see anything in this topic that is no longer correct or that just bothers you in some way you can't really explain, please fix it by submitting a pull request with the changes.

trans-unit.source: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization
trans-unit.target: Sign up for GitHub and the Microsoft organization

trans-unit.source: There are two main steps in getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub: creating a GitHub account and then connecting it to the Microsoft organization.
trans-unit.target: There are two main steps in getting set up for Open Publishing on GitHub: creating a GitHub account and then connecting it to the Microsoft organization.

trans-unit.source: If you already have a GitHub account you want to use, you can skip the first step.
trans-unit.target: If you already have a GitHub account you want to use, you can skip the first step.

trans-unit.source: **Sign up for GitHub** -- Go to [https://github.com/](https://github.com/) and sign up as a new user.
trans-unit.target: **Sign up for GitHub** -- Go to [https://github.com/](https://github.com/) and sign up as a new user.

trans-unit.source: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.
trans-unit.target: You can use any email account you want to sign up, and your username doesn't have to match your Microsoft alias.

trans-unit.source: **Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization** -- For this step, follow the instructions found at [https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service).
trans-unit.target: **Connect your GitHub account to your alias and the Microsoft organization** -- For this step, follow the instructions found at [https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com/articles/how-to-join-microsoft-github-org-self-service).

trans-unit.source: **Note**: Open Source Hub ([https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com)) is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: Open Source Hub ([https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com](https://opensourcehub.microsoft.com)) is where you manage your connected GitHub profile; you can also create and manage repos and teams.

trans-unit.source: Set up your own personal playground
trans-unit.target: Set up your own personal playground

trans-unit.source: To use the WDG CPub sandbox, all you need to do is:
trans-unit.target: To use the WDG CPub sandbox, all you need to do is:

trans-unit.source: Create folder `<your-alias>` as a child of `wdg-cpub-test`.
trans-unit.target: Create folder `<your-alias>` as a child of `wdg-cpub-test`.

trans-unit.source: Start marking down!
trans-unit.target: Start marking down!

trans-unit.source: As needed, add any topics you'd like to the `TOC.md` file to incorporate into the TOC.
trans-unit.target: As needed, add any topics you'd like to the `TOC.md` file to incorporate into the TOC.

trans-unit.source: The TOC uses markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.) to designate levels.
trans-unit.target: The TOC uses markdown heading syntax (#, ##, etc.) to designate levels.

trans-unit.source: Learn more...
trans-unit.target: Learn more...

trans-unit.source: This section provides resources for learning more about using Open Publishing, Git, and markdown.
trans-unit.target: This section provides resources for learning more about using Open Publishing, Git, and markdown.

trans-unit.source: ...about Open Publishing
trans-unit.target: ...about Open Publishing

trans-unit.source: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP or OPS) has its own set of documentation at [https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction](https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction).
trans-unit.target: MSDN Open Publishing (aka OP or OPS) has its own set of documentation at [https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction](https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/introduction).

trans-unit.source: Be sure to check out the documentation on performing [local builds](https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/partnerdocs/local-build-and-preview) to see how you can preview your content locally and publish to stage simply by pushing to the master.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to check out the documentation on performing [local builds](https://int.msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/openpublishing/docs/partnerdocs/local-build-and-preview) to see how you can preview your content locally and publish to stage simply by pushing to the master.

trans-unit.source: ...about Git
trans-unit.target: ...about Git

trans-unit.source: There are many resources on using Git out there.
trans-unit.target: There are many resources on using Git out there.

trans-unit.source: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub on GitHub itself (see the home page).
trans-unit.target: Great tutorials are available on using GitHub on GitHub itself (see the home page).

trans-unit.source: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:
trans-unit.target: Here are some additional resources some have found helpful:

trans-unit.source: Pro Git online book -- [http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2](http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2)
trans-unit.target: Pro Git online book -- [http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2](http://git-scm.com/book/en/v2)

trans-unit.source: Online Git tutorial -- [http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/](http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/)
trans-unit.target: Online Git tutorial -- [http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/](http://www.sbf5.com/~cduan/technical/git/)

trans-unit.source: Git guided tour -- [http://githowto.com/](http://githowto.com/)
trans-unit.target: Git guided tour -- [http://githowto.com/](http://githowto.com/)

trans-unit.source: Blog post on Git best practices -- [http://sethrobertson.github.io/GitBestPractices/](http://sethrobertson.github.io/GitBestPractices/)
trans-unit.target: Blog post on Git best practices -- [http://sethrobertson.github.io/GitBestPractices/](http://sethrobertson.github.io/GitBestPractices/)

trans-unit.source: Tutorial on Git branching -- [http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/](http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/)
trans-unit.target: Tutorial on Git branching -- [http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/](http://pcottle.github.io/learnGitBranching/)

trans-unit.source: ...about markdown
trans-unit.target: ...about markdown

trans-unit.source: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is [Daring Fireball](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
trans-unit.target: Markdown syntax guides are rampant on the Internet, so feel free to search for one you like, but a good introductory one that also talks about the format's goals and the thinking behind it, is [Daring Fireball](http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).

trans-unit.source: Choosing the right tools
trans-unit.target: Choosing the right tools

trans-unit.source: WDG CPub currently doesn't provide any specific recommendation around which tools you should use for doing markdown authoring and interacting with the repo.
trans-unit.target: WDG CPub currently doesn't provide any specific recommendation around which tools you should use for doing markdown authoring and interacting with the repo.

trans-unit.source: What follows are some options that some have recommended over the past year of various pilot projects.
trans-unit.target: What follows are some options that some have recommended over the past year of various pilot projects.

trans-unit.source: If you come across a tool that you think works better, please add it here and tell us why it works so well.
trans-unit.target: If you come across a tool that you think works better, please add it here and tell us why it works so well.

trans-unit.source: Markdown editing
trans-unit.target: Markdown editing

trans-unit.source: **[VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).
trans-unit.target: **[VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- the new lightweight IDE from Visual Studio has markdown text support (and Git as well).

trans-unit.source: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.
trans-unit.target: Many Microsoft markdown authors have become fans of this.

trans-unit.source: **[MarkdownPad Pro](http://www.markdownpad.com/)** -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.
trans-unit.target: **[MarkdownPad Pro](http://www.markdownpad.com/)** -- A very good full-featured editor; real-time preview is excellent.

trans-unit.source: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).
trans-unit.target: A $15 license needed to use the Pro version which is required to use GitHub-flavored markdown (GFM).

trans-unit.source: **[Atom](http://atom.io)** -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.
trans-unit.target: **[Atom](http://atom.io)** -- An extensible text editor that comes with packages that provide markdown preview as well as GitHub integration.

trans-unit.source: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.
trans-unit.target: Additional packages and updates are constantly being developed.

trans-unit.source: **Notepad** -- For the lover of simplicity.
trans-unit.target: **Notepad** -- For the lover of simplicity.

trans-unit.source: **Visual Studio** -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.
trans-unit.target: **Visual Studio** -- The Markdown Mode plugin provides real-time preview, although as of press time it hasn't been confirmed that it works with VS 2016.

trans-unit.source: The Web Essentialls plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.
trans-unit.target: The Web Essentialls plugin/extension provides a preview and syntax highlighting for .md files in VS2015.

trans-unit.source: Git management
trans-unit.target: Git management

trans-unit.source: **[GitHub](https://github.com)** -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.
trans-unit.target: **[GitHub](https://github.com)** -- You can go quite a ways just using the basic GitHub web UI; you can modify content and push directly or create pull requests.

trans-unit.source: **[GitHub Desktop](https://git-for-windows.github.io/)** -- Allows you to manage different repos and handle merge conflicts.
trans-unit.target: **[GitHub Desktop](https://git-for-windows.github.io/)** -- Allows you to manage different repos and handle merge conflicts.

trans-unit.source: **[Tortoise Git](https://tortoisegit.org/)** -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.
trans-unit.target: **[Tortoise Git](https://tortoisegit.org/)** -- Once installed, you interact with Git by using contextual menu commands in your local repository.

trans-unit.source: **[SourceTree](https://www.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/overview)** -- Git management through a GUI; more straightforward than GitHub Desktop, this is recommended for those who prefer not to use a command-line interface.
trans-unit.target: **[SourceTree](https://www.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/overview)** -- Git management through a GUI; more straightforward than GitHub Desktop, this is recommended for those who prefer not to use a command-line interface.

trans-unit.source: (**Note:** Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions [here](https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Two-Factor+Authentication+%282FA%29+with+GitHub+in+SourceTree).)
trans-unit.target: (**Note:** Because you've enabled two-factor authentication, you'll need to use a personal access token as your password to clone your repo with SourceTree; see instructions [here](https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/Two-Factor+Authentication+%282FA%29+with+GitHub+in+SourceTree).)

trans-unit.source: **[PoshGit](https://github.com/dahlbyk/posh-git)** -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: **[PoshGit](https://github.com/dahlbyk/posh-git)** -- Integrates Git commands with PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell lovers, this is the one for you.
trans-unit.target: PowerShell lovers, this is the one for you.

trans-unit.source: **[Git-Scm](http://www.git-scm.com/downloads)** -- Git on the command line.
trans-unit.target: **[Git-Scm](http://www.git-scm.com/downloads)** -- Git on the command line.

trans-unit.source: Get yourself some markdown in Emacs (which does [exist](http://jblevins.org/projects/markdown-mode/)), and you're kicking it old school.
trans-unit.target: Get yourself some markdown in Emacs (which does [exist](http://jblevins.org/projects/markdown-mode/)), and you're kicking it old school.

trans-unit.source: **Visual Studio/[VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.
trans-unit.target: **Visual Studio/[VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/)** -- These integrate well with GitHub repos as well as VSO.

trans-unit.source: VS2015 also has GitHub repo integration straight out of the box.
trans-unit.target: VS2015 also has GitHub repo integration straight out of the box.

trans-unit.source: Tips and Tricks
trans-unit.target: Tips and Tricks

trans-unit.source: This section is intended for random links to items of interest:
trans-unit.target: This section is intended for random links to items of interest:

trans-unit.source: Command line phobic?
trans-unit.target: Command line phobic?

trans-unit.source: Check out [Recommended tools for beginners](../jasgro/tools-for-beginners.md) for a recommendation on how to get started.
trans-unit.target: Check out [Recommended tools for beginners](../jasgro/tools-for-beginners.md) for a recommendation on how to get started.

trans-unit.source: See Ted Hudek's tips for [converting WDCML to markdown](../tedhudek/wdcml-to-open-publish.md) and his crowd-pleasing [markdown tips](../tedhudek/markdown-tips.md).
trans-unit.target: See Ted Hudek's tips for [converting WDCML to markdown](../tedhudek/wdcml-to-open-publish.md) and his crowd-pleasing [markdown tips](../tedhudek/markdown-tips.md).

trans-unit.source: Don Marshall has put together instructions for [editing content through the GitHub UI](../domars/Directions_To_Update_Existing_Topic_Using_Browser.md) which can be a very painless way to make quick updates.
trans-unit.target: Don Marshall has put together instructions for [editing content through the GitHub UI](../domars/Directions_To_Update_Existing_Topic_Using_Browser.md) which can be a very painless way to make quick updates.
